2227.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|85|309$أَمَّا|"As for|64|88|9007$مَن|(one) who|88|112|76$ظَلَمَ|wrongs,|72|96|2039$فَسَوْفَ|then soon|86|110|3931$نُعَذِّبُهُۥ|we will punish him.|143|167|10992$ثُمَّ|Then|53|65|293$يُرَدُّ|he will be returned|143|160|6151$إِلَىٰ|to|53|87|118$رَبِّهِۦ|his Lord,|76|110|392$فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ|and He will punish him|165|199|10993$عَذَابًا|(with) a punishment|153|170|2933$نُّكْرًا|terrible.|71|71|10929$

2224.verse: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.

2226.verse: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

2227.verse: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.

2228.verse: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."

2230.verse: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

2231.verse: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

2233.verse: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

2234.verse: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

2235.verse: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.

2236.verse: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

2237.verse: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.
